title.narrative: Strengthening institutions that manage asylum processes in Kenya

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Increased fairness of national refugee status determination procedures

1. Percentage of RSD applications requiring a complementary interview after review. 2. Number of DRS staff trained in the curriculum on enhanced RSD learning and interviewing skills. 3. Number of DRS staff completing Training of Trainers curriculum on RSD learning, interview techniques and general facilitation techniques. 4. Number of DRS staff conducting registration and supporting RSD trained in the curriculum on refugee protection and RSD processes. 5. Number of curriculums on enhanced RSD assessment skills, interview skills and support to RSD developed. 6. Number of DRS staff trained in Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA). 7. Number of cases of SEA identified through reporting channels of DRS and UNHCR.
Enhanced efficiency of national refugee status determination procedures

1. Percentage of complex RSD applications requiring a complementary interview after review. 2. Average processing time (in days) for prioritized RSD cases from referral to first instance RSD asylum decision. 3. Percentage of PoCs who do not attend their interviews after receiving an appointment (no-show rate). 4. Number of managers for RSD support services recruited. 5. Number of SOPs updated. 6. Number of RSD officers for complex cases recruited and trained. 7. Number of tool for case-referral mechanism for RSD prioritization developed. 8. Number of first instance decisions in 12 months.
Strengthened adaptability of national refugee status determination procedures
1. Quality process analysis and case file audit implemented. 2. Percentage of the recommendations of a quality process analysis and case file audit implemented after 18 months.

1. Asylum-seekers have access to fair, efficient and adaptable national refugee status determination procedures. 2. Refugees and asylum-seekers benefit from a robust and efficient national protection framework that enables them to enjoy fundamental rights and access to protection services, in line with international, regional and national standards and obligations.

1.1. Percentage of RSD applications finalized within 6 month of first instance interview. 1.2 Satisfaction rating of PoCs with regard to interviews and the overall RSD process. 2.1. Proportion of PoCs who are reported refouled. 2.2. Extent regulations to the Refugees Act, 2021 are enacted and operationalized.

target.value: 1.1. 75% 1.2. An increase of 10% from the baseline rate 2.1. 0 2.2. 60%

title.narrative: Awareness of the new Refugees Act, 2021 and other relevant legislation for concerned government officials and refugees.

1. Number of PoCs arrested or detained related to immigration control or legal status. 2. Number of persons denied access to asylum. 3. Implementing Regulations developed with support provided to GOK. 4. Number of DRS staff trained on the provisions of the Refugees Act, 2021. 5. Number of court users’ committees trained on the changes brought on by the Refugees Act, 2021. 6. Number of the refugees reached to raise awareness on the provisions of the Refugees Act, 2021. 7. Number of information and communication materials developed and/or revised. 8. Curriculum for refugee management and protection developed for the Judicial Training Institute 9. Number of judges trained on the curriculum for refugee management and protection developed for the Judicial Training Institute. 10. Judicial Officer’s Handbook on Refugee Law updated. 11. Number of members of court users’ committee trained on refugee protection following the update of the Judicial Officer’s Handbook on Refugee Law.
